algorithmSettings.description: Integer seed for random number generator

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Change the building location
arguments.option_2: Option 2 Description: Change the building location

arguments.name: weather_file_name
arguments.description: Name of the weather file to change to. This is the filename with the extension (e.g. NewWeather.epw). Optionally this can inclucde the full file path, but for most use cases should just be file name.

options.description: Option 1 Description: Change the building location

options.name: ChangeBuildingLocation Denver
options.description: Option 2 Description: Change the building location

measures.name: create_bar_from_building_type_ratios
measures.display_name: Create Bar From Building Type Ratios
measures.description: Create a core and perimeter bar sliced by space type.
measures.modeler_description: Space Type collections are made from one or more building types passed in with user arguments.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Create a core and perimeter bar sliced by space type.
arguments.option_2: Option 2 Description: Create a core and perimeter bar sliced by space type.

arguments.name: bldg_type_a_num_units
arguments.display_name: Primary Building Type Number of Units

arguments.name: bldg_type_b_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type B Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_b_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type B Number of Units

arguments.name: bldg_type_c_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type C Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_c_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type C Number of Units

arguments.name: bldg_type_d_fract_bldg_area
arguments.display_name: Building Type D Fraction of Building Floor Area

arguments.name: bldg_type_d_num_units
arguments.display_name: Building Type D Number of Units

arguments.name: single_floor_area
arguments.description: Non-zero value will fix the single floor area, overriding a user entry for Total Building Floor Area

arguments.name: floor_height
arguments.description: Selecting a typical floor height of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

arguments.name: building_rotation
arguments.description: Set Building Rotation off of North (positive value is clockwise).

arguments.name: ns_to_ew_ratio
arguments.display_name: Ratio of North/South Facade Length Relative to East/West Facade Length.
arguments.description: Selecting an aspect ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default. Aspect ratios less than one are not recommended for sliced bar geometry, instead rotate building and use a greater than 1 aspect ratio

arguments.name: wwr
arguments.description: Selecting a window to wall ratio of 0 will trigger a smart building type default.

arguments.name: party_wall_fraction
arguments.display_name: Fraction of Exterior Wall Area with Adjacent Structure
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition.

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_north
arguments.display_name: Number of North facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior north walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_south
arguments.display_name: Number of South facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior south walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_east
arguments.display_name: Number of East facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior east walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: party_wall_stories_west
arguments.display_name: Number of West facing stories with party wall
arguments.description: This will impact how many above grade exterior west walls are modeled with adiabatic boundary condition. If this is less than the number of above grade stoes, upper flor will reamin exterior

arguments.name: bottom_story_ground_exposed_floor
arguments.display_name: Is the Bottom Story Exposed to Ground?
arguments.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the lowest story. The bottom story floor will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

arguments.name: top_story_exterior_exposed_roof
arguments.display_name: Is the Top Story an Exterior Roof?
arguments.description: This should be true unless you are modeling a partial building which doesn't include the highest story. The top story ceiling will have an adiabatic boundary condition when false.

arguments.name: bar_division_method
arguments.display_name: Division Method for Bar Space Types.
arguments.default_value: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
choice_values: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
Single Space Type - Core and Perimeter

arguments.option_1: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced
arguments.option_2: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced

arguments.name: make_mid_story_surfaces_adiabatic
arguments.display_name: Make Mid Story Floor Surfaces Adibatic
arguments.description: If set to true, this will skip surface intersection and make mid story floors and celings adiabiatc, not just at multiplied gaps.

arguments.name: bar_division_method
arguments.value: Multiple Space Types - Individual Stories Sliced

measures.name: create_typical_building_from_model
measures.description: Takes a model with space and stub space types, and assigns constructions, schedules, internal loads, hvac, and other loads such as exterior lights and service water heating. The end result is somewhat like a custom protptye model with user geometry, but it may use different HVAC systems.
measures.modeler_description: Initially this was intended for stub space types, but it is possible that it will be run on models tha talready have internal loads, schedules, or constructions that should be preserved. Set it up to support addition at later date of bool args to skip specific types of model elements.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: Takes a model with space and stub space types, and assigns constructions, schedules, internal loads, hvac, and other loads such as exterior lights and service water heating. The end result is somewhat like a custom protptye model with user geometry, but it may use different HVAC systems.

arguments.name: clg_src
arguments.description: The primary source of cooling used by HVAC systems in the model.

arguments.display_name: Add Space Type Loads to Model
arguments.description: Populate existing space types in model with internal loads.

arguments.name: add_elevators
arguments.description: Elevators will be add directly to space in model vs. being applied to a space type.

arguments.name: add_exterior_lights
arguments.description: Multiple exterior lights objects will be added for different classes of lighting such as parking and facade.

arguments.name: onsite_parking_fraction
arguments.description: If set to 0 no exterior lighting for parking will be added

arguments.name: add_exhaust
arguments.description: Depending upon building type exhaust fans can be in kitchens, restrooms or other space types

arguments.description: This will add both the supply and demand side of service water heating.

arguments.description: Add Thermost to model based on Space Type Standards information of spaces assigned to thermal zones.

arguments.description: Add HVAC System and thermostats to model

arguments.description: Only removes objects of type that are selected to be added.

options.name: CreateTypicalModel
options.description: Option 1 Description: Takes a model with space and stub space types, and assigns constructions, schedules, internal loads, hvac, and other loads such as exterior lights and service water heating. The end result is somewhat like a custom protptye model with user geometry, but it may use different HVAC systems.

measures.name: tariff_selection_generic
measures.description: This measure creates tariff objets from pre-poulated IDF files in the measures "resoruces" directory.
measures.modeler_description: The timestep for the simulation will be changed to four timesteps per hour to me more compatable with a variety of demand window lnegths that may be in tariff objects in the resources directory.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: This measure creates tariff objets from pre-poulated IDF files in the measures "resoruces" directory.

options.name: Tariff
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure creates tariff objets from pre-poulated IDF files in the measures "resoruces" directory.

measures.name: openstudio_results
measures.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
measures.modeler_description: For the most part consumption data comes from the tabular EnergyPlus results, however there are a few requests added for time series results. Space type and loop details come from the OpenStudio model. The code for this is modular, making it easy to use as a template for your own custom reports. The structure of the report uses bootstrap, and the graphs use dimple js.

arguments.option_1: Option 1 Description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.

options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
